comment.body:
KaffieID doesn't send any requests outside of ZeroNet. You can register one completely offline even. This definitely helps if you're trying to be anonymous.

As for me, I'm still around. Just less chatty/active.

@Nofish: Lacking name uniqueness was an intended feature of KaffieID. The point is to help encourage a bigger focus on the actual auth_address, rather than username, and to allow users to freely change their name.

It's how names work when you lack a centralized back-end server. Nothing wrong with that. Just need to be a bit careful.
@Waterfire: Haha I suppose so. I really do want to be more active though. ZeroNet is great.
